alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:05PM EST until January 12 at 7:28AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Louisburg affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Louisburg. * WHEN...From late tonight to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Bankfull in the vicinity of Main Street. Minor flooding begins in River Bend Park 0.1 miles upstream of Main Street. At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Banks overflow at Main Street. River Bend Park is flooded and storm drains are inundated along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 20.6 feet by tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Tar River Louisbur 20.0 18.1 Wed 8 pm EST 20.1 12.2 10.6 9.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 915 AM EST.
